metadata.description: Curated evaluation dataset for testing retrieval quality, answer accuracy, and system performance of the Legal RAG system.

test_queries.query: What are the requirements for a broker to earn commission on a real estate transaction?
test_queries.notes: Should retrieve cases discussing broker commission requirements and real estate transactions

test_queries.query: What constitutes criminal intent for indecent exposure charges?
expected_answer_points: Intent must be shown before conviction
Intent is general, not directed at specific persons
Exposure becomes indecent when defendant knows or should know it will be observed
Intent can be inferred from reckless conduct
test_queries.notes: Peyton v. District of Columbia discusses criminal intent for indecent exposure

test_queries.query: Does the Municipal Court have jurisdiction to grant declaratory judgments?
expected_answer_points: Municipal Court lacks jurisdiction for declaratory judgments
Federal Declaratory Judgments Act applies only to courts created by Congress with judges holding office during good behavior
Municipal Court judges hold office for limited terms
test_queries.notes: Branson v. Harris directly addresses Municipal Court jurisdiction for declaratory judgments

test_queries.query: Is a wagering tax act that requires registration unconstitutional under the Fifth Amendment?
expected_answer_points: Wagering tax act held constitutional
Registration required before entering business, not after accepting wagers
No self-incrimination for future acts
Supreme Court upheld in Kahriger case
test_queries.notes: United States v. Lewis discusses constitutionality of wagering tax with Fifth Amendment analysis

test_queries.query: Can prior convictions be used to determine guilt in a current criminal case?
expected_answer_points: Prior convictions may be brought out on cross-examination
Must be restricted to credibility question only
Cannot be considered for determining guilt or innocence of current offense
Trial judge properly used it for credibility, not guilt determination
test_queries.notes: Discusses proper use of prior convictions for credibility vs guilt

test_queries.query: What relief can a court grant if it lacks jurisdiction over the type of claim filed?
expected_answer_points: Court cannot grant relief for claims outside its jurisdiction
Court not bound by prayer for relief in some cases
Party must request alternative relief from trial court
No relief granted if only requested relief is beyond jurisdiction
test_queries.notes: Addresses what happens when court lacks jurisdiction for requested relief

test_queries.query: What standard of review do district courts use when determining if an act of Congress is unconstitutional?
expected_answer_points: Determining constitutionality is grave and delicate duty
Presumption in favor of validity of Congressional acts
Only declare unconstitutional when free from reasonable doubt
District courts should exercise even greater restraint than appellate courts
Courts of limited jurisdiction should only challenge when unconstitutionality is glaring
test_queries.notes: Detailed discussion of judicial restraint in constitutional review

test_queries.query: How is intent established in public indecency cases?
expected_answer_points: Intent established by actions drawing attention to exposed condition
Display in public place presumes intent to be seen
Intent can be inferred from recklessness of conduct
Intent is question of fact
test_queries.notes: Discusses methods of establishing intent in indecent exposure cases

test_queries.query: What happens to ownership rights in jointly titled property when one owner dies?
test_queries.notes: Branson v. Harris involves dispute over jointly owned automobile after death

test_queries.query: Can an appellate court reverse a trial court's factual findings?
expected_answer_points: Appellate court may only set aside judgment on factual issue when plainly wrong
Must be without evidence to support finding
Substantial evidence standard applies
Intent is basically a question of fact
test_queries.notes: Discusses appellate review of factual determinations

test_queries.query: What elements must be proven to establish a valid contract?
test_queries.notes: General contract law question to test retrieval of relevant cases

test_queries.query: What is required to prove negligence in a personal injury case?
test_queries.notes: General tort law question to test retrieval

test_queries.query: What is the difference between accidental and intentional conduct in criminal law?
test_queries.notes: Peyton discusses intentional vs accidental exposure

test_queries.query: What is the Federal Declaratory Judgments Act and which courts does it apply to?
expected_answer_points: Confers jurisdiction on 'courts of the United States'
Defined as courts created by Congress with judges holding office during good behavior
Does not apply to Municipal Court
test_queries.notes: Specific statutory interpretation question

test_queries.query: Does registering for a wagering tax constitute self-incrimination?
expected_answer_points: Registration for future acts is not self-incrimination
Privilege relates only to past acts, not future acts
Must register before entering business
Cannot claim privilege if failed to register
test_queries.notes: Specific Fifth Amendment analysis

test_queries.query: What are the requirements for workplace discrimination claims?
test_queries.notes: Test query for cases that may not be in the dataset

test_queries.query: What factors do courts consider in child custody determinations?
test_queries.notes: Test query for cases that may not be in the dataset

test_queries.query: How is ownership determined when title is registered in multiple names?
test_queries.notes: Case involves automobile with title in both names and ownership dispute

test_queries.query: What makes a location a 'public place' for purposes of criminal statutes?
test_queries.notes: Peyton discusses public place element

test_queries.query: Can parties claim relief they did not request in their complaint?
expected_answer_points: Municipal Court Rule 54(c) limits relief to what was requested
Party must request alternative relief from trial court
Cannot claim new relief for first time on appeal
test_queries.notes: Discusses limitations on relief not requested below

test_queries.query: Can photographs be admitted as evidence to show the scene of a crime?
test_queries.notes: Peyton mentions photographs of scene introduced by defendant

test_queries.query: What is the relationship between federal tax law and state gambling laws?
test_queries.notes: United States v. Lewis discusses federal wagering tax and D.C. gambling laws

test_queries.query: What evidence standard applies to uphold a criminal conviction?
expected_answer_points: Must be substantial evidence to support finding
Appellate court reviews whether finding against weight of evidence
test_queries.notes: Discusses evidence standard for criminal convictions

test_queries.query: What is the effect of a prior judgment on related claims?
test_queries.notes: Branson mentions prior replevin action and its effect on current case

test_queries.query: How do courts determine if a statute is a tax or a penalty?
expected_answer_points: Court must determine legislative purpose
Wagering act held to be tax, not penalty
Supreme Court in Kahriger validated as proper tax
test_queries.notes: Discusses tax vs penalty distinction

test_queries.query: What issues can be raised for the first time on appeal?
test_queries.notes: Branson discusses claims raised for first time on appeal

test_queries.query: Can a defendant's testimony be used against them on cross-examination?
test_queries.notes: Peyton discusses defendant's testimony and cross-examination

test_queries.query: What deference do lower courts owe to Supreme Court decisions?
expected_answer_points: Municipal Court cannot adopt different construction than Supreme Court
Supreme Court ruling in Kahriger is controlling
Lower courts must follow Supreme Court interpretation
test_queries.notes: Discusses binding nature of Supreme Court precedent

test_queries.query: What is the proper use of prior conviction evidence?
expected_answer_points: Prior convictions admissible for credibility only
Cannot be used to determine guilt of current offense
Trial court must limit use to credibility question
test_queries.notes: Clear rule on prior conviction evidence

test_queries.query: What are the requirements for seeking alternative forms of relief?
test_queries.notes: Branson discusses seeking alternative relief when primary claim fails

test_queries.query: Is reckless conduct sufficient to prove criminal intent?
expected_answer_points: Intent can be inferred from recklessness of conduct
Reckless exposure in public place supports finding of intent
test_queries.notes: Discusses recklessness as evidence of intent

test_queries.query: Can Congress require registration before engaging in otherwise legal activity?
test_queries.notes: United States v. Lewis discusses required registration before accepting wagers

test_queries.query: What is the effect of an assignment of property interest?
test_queries.notes: Branson involves assignment of interest in automobile

test_queries.query: What is the standard for reversing a trial court's decision?
test_queries.notes: Peyton discusses when appellate court can reverse

test_queries.query: What is required to prove an act of Congress violates the Constitution?
expected_answer_points: Must be free from reasonable doubt
Presumption in favor of Congressional acts
Plain mandate of Constitution must be violated
Higher burden for lower courts
test_queries.notes: Detailed discussion of constitutional challenge requirements

test_queries.query: What is required to prove a crime was committed in a public place?
test_queries.notes: Peyton involves crime in public place near river/golf course

test_queries.query: Can a defendant introduce evidence in their own defense and still be impeached?
test_queries.notes: Peyton - defendant testified and was cross-examined about prior convictions

test_queries.query: Does the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination apply to regulatory schemes?
test_queries.notes: United States v. Lewis discusses Fifth Amendment in context of wagering tax

test_queries.query: What must a party prove to succeed in a declaratory judgment action?
test_queries.notes: Branson involves failed declaratory judgment action

test_queries.query: What weight is given to a defendant's denial of intent?
test_queries.notes: Defendant denied intent but court found otherwise based on circumstances

test_queries.query: Can an appellate court consider issues not raised in the trial court?
test_queries.notes: Branson discusses raising new relief arguments on appeal

test_queries.query: What is the significance of the Kahriger Supreme Court decision?
expected_answer_points: Upheld constitutionality of wagering tax act
Held registration required before entering business
No Fifth Amendment violation
Tax not penalty in disguise
test_queries.notes: Multiple references to Kahriger as controlling precedent

test_queries.query: What types of evidence can establish criminal intent?
test_queries.notes: Peyton discusses various ways intent can be shown

test_queries.query: What happens when there is a dispute over jointly owned property after one owner's death?
test_queries.notes: Core issue in Branson v. Harris

test_queries.query: What remedies are available when a court lacks subject matter jurisdiction?
expected_answer_points: Court must dismiss if it lacks jurisdiction
Cannot grant any relief beyond jurisdiction
Party may need to refile in proper court
test_queries.notes: Discusses consequences of lack of jurisdiction

test_queries.query: What role do district courts play in determining constitutionality of federal statutes?
expected_answer_points: District courts should exercise great restraint
Should not strike down acts unless plainly unconstitutional
Uniformity concerns counsel against hasty invalidation
Courts of limited jurisdiction should be even more cautious
test_queries.notes: Extended discussion of judicial restraint

test_queries.query: How is the public nature of a location established for criminal purposes?
test_queries.notes: Peyton - crime occurred in car parked on public road near golf course

test_queries.query: What is the standard for determining witness credibility?
test_queries.notes: Trial court assessed credibility of defendant's testimony

test_queries.query: What must an appellant show to prevail on appeal?
test_queries.notes: Both Peyton and Branson discuss appellate review

test_queries.query: Can a tax statute be challenged as unconstitutional if it has been upheld by multiple courts?
expected_answer_points: Strong precedent from multiple courts weighs heavily
Supreme Court decision is controlling
Lower court should not strike down act upheld by Supreme Court
Six other district courts upheld same act
test_queries.notes: Discusses weight of precedent in constitutional challenges

retrieval_metrics.name: Precision@5
retrieval_metrics.description: Percentage of top 5 retrieved cases that are relevant

retrieval_metrics.name: Recall@5
retrieval_metrics.description: Percentage of all relevant cases retrieved in top 5

retrieval_metrics.name: MRR (Mean Reciprocal Rank)
retrieval_metrics.description: Average of 1/rank of first relevant result

answer_quality_metrics.name: Faithfulness
answer_quality_metrics.description: Does answer cite only information from retrieved sources?

answer_quality_metrics.name: Relevance
answer_quality_metrics.description: Does answer address the question asked?

answer_quality_metrics.name: Completeness
answer_quality_metrics.description: Does answer cover all expected points?

answer_quality_metrics.name: Citation Accuracy
answer_quality_metrics.description: Are all citations verifiable in retrieved cases?

performance_metrics.name: Query Latency
performance_metrics.description: Total time from query to response

performance_metrics.name: LLM Generation Time
performance_metrics.description: Time for Claude to generate answer

usage_instructions.running_evaluation: See evaluate_rag.py script for automated evaluation
usage_instructions.adding_queries: Add new queries to test_queries array with all required fields
usage_instructions.updating_ground_truth: After running system, update relevant_case_ids with actual retrieved cases for future benchmarking
